items.sentence: Tom didn\'t seem to be as excited as Mary seemed to be.
Tom thinks that Mary spends too much time on her phone.
Tom thought he was better at French than he really was.
My cousin is the second to the last person in the line.
You\'re a better chess player than Tom is, aren\'t you?
You\'re drunk, Tom. Get in the taxi. We\'re going home.
You\'re much better at French than Tom is, aren\'t you?
I didn\'t tell Tom that I didn\'t have time to do that.
Have you seen the necklace Tom gave Mary for Christmas?
I hope this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
Tom couldn\'t believe that Mary had actually said that.
Luckily, all of the passengers were wearing seat belts.
Mary was wearing a pink blouse with matching miniskirt.
I\'d go with you if I didn\'t have such a bad headache.
I\'d have given Tom some money if I\'d had any to give.
The doctor told Tom that he needed to lose some weight.
The doctor told Tom to reduce his red meat consumption.
The factory where Tom works is going to be closed down.
The first stage of the operation has been accomplished.
Both Tom and Mary know that that\'s unlikely to happen.
